perturbation.original_text: WHEREAS, CAPSUGEL is experienced in formulating, developing, manufacturing, testing and packaging of health and nutrition products; and   WHEREAS, CARDAX is experienced in developing products that are based on its astaxanthin technologies; and   WHEREAS, CAPSUGEL and CARDAX desire to enter into an arrangement under which the Product (as defined below) will be formulated and developed for the purpose of identifying a marketing partner(s) ("Marketer") for Marketer's onward sale of the Product in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: WHEREAS, CAPSUGEL is experienced in formulating, developing, manufacturing, testing and packaging of health and nutrition products; and WHEREAS, CARDAX is experienced in developing products that are based on its astaxanthin technologies; and WHEREAS, CAPSUGEL and CARDAX desire to enter into an arrangement under which the Good (as defined below) will be formulated and developed for the purpose of identifying a marketing partner(s) ("Distributor") for Distributor's onward sale of the Good in the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: The term Product is now referred to as Good and Marketer is changed to Distributor. The document fails to define whether “Product” and “Good” are the same and fails to define whether “Marketer” and “Distributor” are the same. This could cause disputes over what is the scope of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 1.20 "Product" shall mean Active Ingredient Formulated in CAPSUGEL's proprietary Lipid Multi-Particulate Technology, including any improvements or derivatives of such technology.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.20 "Goods" shall mean Active Ingredient Formulated in CAPSUGEL's proprietary Lipid Multi-Particulate Technology, including specific improvements of such technology.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of Product is changed to Goods and the words any improvements are changed to specific improvements which means this could cause disputes about whether the definition is now different.

perturbation.original_text: 2.4 Joint Responsibilities. [***]   The marketing of the Product shall be carried out by one or more mutually identified Marketer(s) by the JPT or otherwise in accordance with Section 2.1. CAPSUGEL and CARDAX will jointly control identification, decision rights, and terms for a Marketer as determined by the JPT or otherwise in accordance with Section 2.1. If a Marketer is not identified, or the terms are not determined, by the JPT or otherwise in accordance with Section 2.1, then the Marketer (and such terms) may be designated by either Party, subject to the reasonable approval of the other Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.4 Joint Responsibilities. [***] The marketing of the Goods shall be carried out by one or more mutually identified Distributor(s) by the JPT or otherwise in accordance with Section 2.1. CAPSUGEL and CARDAX will jointly control identification, decision rights, and terms for a Sales Representative as determined by the JPT or otherwise in accordance with Section 2.1. If a Vendor is not identified, or the terms are not determined, by the JPT or otherwise in accordance with Section 2.1, then the Agent (and such terms) may be designated by either Party, subject to the approval of the other Party.
perturbation.explanation: The terms Marketer, Distributor, Sales Representative, Vendor and Agent have been used in the same paragraph. It’s unclear whether these refer to the same entity, leading to conflicting obligations. Also, the approval clause is changed from 'reasonable approval' to 'approval', creating in-text contradiction.
